intro: Licaria tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf licaria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow to white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Licaria tenuifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
